p:
Coronaviruses are widespread in nature. It can cause respiratory and intestinal infections in animals and humans. According to the phylogenetic relationships, coronavirus can be divided into four genera: Alpha, Beta, Gamma and Delta. Alpha and beta genera can infect mammals, while gamma and delta genera are mostly avian coronaviruses
9 . There are seven known coronavirus that can infect humans: 229E, OC43, NL63, HKU1, SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2. The first four viruses cause only mild minor respiratory illness. The other three strains—SARS-CoV, MERS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2—are zoonotic and lead to severe respiratory syndrome 10, 11, 12.
